intro: Astragalus orcuttianus var. gregorius, commonly known as Gregor's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. It has adapted to survive in harsh conditions with its deep root system and ability to fix nitrogen. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
